title: Sri Lanka stock market closed for 2nd day amid curfew
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) was closed on Wednesday May 11 for a second straight day amid curfew after violence killed at least 8 people including a ruling party legislator and left over 220 injured while the CSE cited closure of banks as the reason for shutting down the market.
For CSE press release on the closure, click here: CSE Media Release-Market Holiday on 11th May 2022
